oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Willie Cooper
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Portrait of Willie Cooper, Nashville, Tenn., 1901

Willie Cooper was a substitute teacher at Merry School for the 1909-1910 and 1910-1911 school years. The Merry School was an African American elementary school located on Springhead St. (now Andrew T. Whitmore St.), southeast of Nashville City Cemetery.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cooper, Willie
